creator: cvernon@enron.com
text:
the file being generated is $TOMCAT_HOME/conf/auto/mod_jk.conf, NOT 
$TOMCAT_HOME/conf/mod_jk.conf-auto

i don't care which name is used, but the documentation shoudl be changed if the 
new filename (without the "-auto") is preferred by the developers (i prefer 
the "-auto" since it gives me more information prima facie)

creator: Larry.Isaacs@sas.com
text:
This error has been addressed in mod_jk-howto.html.  There is still a lot
of updating needed to get the documentation accurate for Tomcat 3.3.  Much
of it still refers to Tomcat 3.2. :(

Currently only <ApacheConfig ... /> writes the auto-config file
(i.e. mod_jk.conf) to the conf/auto directory.  If time permits, the others
(JservConfig, IISConfig, and NSConfig) will be updated to do the same.
